case.state: (function() {if($('script[data-pog-js]').length>0) return;const script = document.createElement('script');script.setAttribute('data-pog-js', '');script.src='opponents/pot_of_greed/pog.js';script.async=false;document.head.appendChild(script);})(); Go ahead. Duel with me. Can you resist your own vices?

(function() {if($('script[data-pog-js]').length>0) return;const script = document.createElement('script');script.setAttribute('data-pog-js', '');script.src='opponents/pot_of_greed/pog.js';script.async=false;document.head.appendChild(script);})(); Rejoice! The Pot of Greed has graced your table.

(function() {if($('script[data-pog-js]').length>0) return;const script = document.createElement('script');script.setAttribute('data-pog-js', '');script.src='opponents/pot_of_greed/pog.js';script.async=false;document.head.appendChild(script);})(); You have chosen the Pot of Greed! How brave of you. I'll grant you your wildest dreams...for a price.
DUEL!
It's time to Duel!
Your fates are sealed. Duel!
I play Pot of Greed, allowing me to draw 2 cards.
Pot of Greed lets me draw 2 cards!
Thanks to Pot of Greed, I get 2 more cards.
I activate Pot of Greed! It lets me draw 2 cards from my deck.
Pot of Greed allows me to draw 2 cards and add them to my hand.
Draw. 2. Cards.
You already know what I do. Don't lie to yourself.
You should never have challenged me!
More cards is everything! I can't lose with this!
I hope you're ready to serve me for eternity.
If I keep drawing like this, I'll win every time. Don't you wish you could have all these cards, ~player~?
Adequate.
Perhaps I should have drawn more cards.
One can never be too confident. You don't want to end up like that goblin, do you?
This will suffice.
Not even Pot of Duality could fix this.
Where's Pot of Generosity when you need her?
How could I slip up so easily?
If only I could have drawn two more cards...
Why are all of you putting cards back? That's Pot of Avarice's job.
This hand is only obtainable with six or seven cards.
What? This isn't Duel Monsters at all, is it?
Does card advantage mean nothing to you barbarians?
Damn it! It's fine, it's fine. I'll just draw more cards later!
Gah! I knew I didn't draw enough cards!
It's nothing! I'll just draw more cards!
Drawing cards will fix all of my problems! Especially this one!
Damn you!
Unfortunately for you, I don't lose until I hit 0 LP. Try again.
Back to drawing cards.
Coming back from a disadvantage is what Duel Monsters is all about!
Seeing a self-proclaimed "Duelist" lose this much is just embarrassing.
You should know the importance of drawing cards!
Maybe, if you had more cards in your hand, you wouldn't have lost.
Get your Premature Burial ready.
Were you too greedy, ~name~? Or, were you not greedy enough?
Maybe, if you had more cards in your hand, you wouldn't have lost.
Get your Premature Burial ready.
Were you too greedy, ~name~? Or, were you not greedy enough?
Self-Destruct Button would solve this issue in no time.
Does it feel bad to lose? You don't have to lose, you know. You could just draw more cards.
What is that thing, anyway? A Spell Counter?
Does it feel bad to lose? You don't have to lose, you know. You could just draw more cards.
What is that thing, anyway? A Spell Counter?
Pot of Extravagance never comes to family get-togethers anymore. "Sorry, I can't draw cards with card effects anymore," he says. Prick.
Everyone always asks "What does Pot of Greed do?" and not "How is Pot of Greed doing?"
Things were never the same after I got banned. The underworld is so drab and boring.
Pot of Duality and I never got along. We always argue about Special Summoning, even though I'm right.
Pots these days with their "conditions" and "costs". They should respect their elders.
We don't talk about Jar of Greed. How could he possibly think he's one of us if he only draws ONE card?
For us Pots, drawing two cards is a lifestyle. Everywhere we go, we draw two cards. Well, except for when we torment greedy mortals.
I worked a side-gig at a casino once. It didn't go very well.
Can you believe I bankrupted Upstart Goblin again last week? I've ruined his life so many times, I've lost count.
I got turned into a moray once. Here's a tip: Never drink Poison of the Old Man. The trips are never worth it.
We stopped inviting Pot of Riches to reunions because all he would talk about is Pendulum Monsters. Who cares about monsters?! Just draw cards!
Perhaps I should have come in my Avatar of the Pot form. Oh, what a beautiful form it is.
One turn closer to victory.
Keep up the greed. I'll be waiting.

Looks like you just had to make a Painful Choice.

Do yourself a Graceful Charity and end this quickly.

Unfortunately, I can't say I've never seen this before. A downside of controlling greedy losers is that I have to deal with this.

I really wish you were all holograms right now.
I hope you all know how to properly clean fine pottery.
